verses.verse: Misery <S%H480><s%> is mine! <S%H625><s%> Indeed, I am like one who gathers the summer fruits, <S%H7019><s%> as gleanings <S%H5955><s%> of the vineyard: <S%H1210><s%> There is no cluster <S%H811><s%> of grapes to eat. <S%H398><s%> My soul <S%H5315><s%> desires <S%H183><s%> to eat the early fig. <S%H1063><s%>

The godly <S%H2623><s%> man has perished <S%H6><s%> out of the earth, <S%H776><s%> and there is no one upright <S%H3477><s%> among men. <S%H120><s%> They all lie in wait <S%H693><s%> for blood; <S%H1818><s%> every man <S%H376><s%> hunts <S%H6679><s%> his brother <S%H251><s%> with a net. <S%H2764><s%>

Their hands <S%H3709><s%> are on that which is evil <S%H7451><s%> to do it diligently. <S%H3190><s%> The ruler <S%H8269><s%> and judge <S%H8199><s%> ask <S%H7592><s%> for a bribe; <S%H7966><s%> and the powerful <S%H1419><s%> man dictates <S%H1696><s%> the evil <S%H1942><s%> desire <S%H5315><s%> of his soul. <S%H5686><s%> Thus they conspire together.

The best <S%H2896><s%> of them is like a brier. <S%H2312><s%> The most upright <S%H3477><s%> is worse than a thorn hedge. <S%H4534><s%> The day <S%H3117><s%> of your watchmen, <S%H6822><s%> even your visitation, <S%H6486><s%> has come; <S%H935><s%> now is the time of their confusion. <S%H3998><s%>

Don't <S%H539><s%> trust in a neighbor. <S%H7453><s%> Don't <S%H982><s%> put confidence in a friend. <S%H7453><s%> With the woman lying <S%H7901><s%> in your embrace, <S%H2436><s%> be careful <S%H8104><s%> of the words <S%H6607><s%> of your mouth! <S%H6310><s%>

For the son <S%H1121><s%> dishonors <S%H5034><s%> the father, <S%H1><s%> the daughter <S%H1323><s%> rises up <S%H6965><s%> against her mother, <S%H517><s%> the daughter-in <S%H2545><s%>-law against her mother-in <S%H3618><s%>-law; a man <S%H376><s%>'s enemies <S%H341><s%> are the men <S%H582><s%> of his own house. <S%H1004><s%>
But as for me, <S%H6822><s%> I will look to Yahweh. <S%H3068><s%> I will wait <S%H3176><s%> for the God <S%H430><s%> of my salvation. <S%H3468><s%> My God <S%H430><s%> will hear me. <S%H8085><s%>

Don't <S%H8055><s%> rejoice against me, <S%H341><s%> my enemy. When I fall, <S%H5307><s%> I will arise. <S%H6965><s%> When I sit <S%H3427><s%> in darkness, <S%H2822><s%> Yahweh <S%H3068><s%> will be a light to me. <S%H216><s%>

I will bear <S%H5375><s%> the indignation <S%H2197><s%> of Yahweh, <S%H3068><s%> because I have sinned <S%H2398><s%> against him, <S%H7378><s%> until he pleads my case, <S%H7379><s%> and executes <S%H6213><s%> judgment <S%H4941><s%> for me. <S%H3318><s%> He will bring me forth to the light. <S%H216><s%> I will see <S%H7200><s%> his righteousness. <S%H6666><s%>

Then my enemy <S%H341><s%> will see <S%H7200><s%> it, <S%H955><s%> and shame will cover <S%H3680><s%> her who said <S%H559><s%> to me, <S%H3068><s%> where is Yahweh your God? <S%H430><s%> Then my enemy will see <S%H7200><s%> me and will cover <S%H5869><s%> her shame. <S%H4823><s%> Now she will be trodden down like the mire <S%H2916><s%> of the streets. <S%H2351><s%>
A day <S%H3117><s%> to build <S%H1129><s%> your walls <S%H1447><s%>â€” In that day, <S%H3117><s%> he will extend <S%H2706><s%> your boundary. <S%H7368><s%>

In that day <S%H3117><s%> they will come <S%H935><s%> to you from Assyria <S%H804><s%> and the cities <S%H5892><s%> of Egypt, <S%H4693><s%> and from Egypt <S%H4693><s%> even to the River, <S%H5104><s%> and from sea <S%H3220><s%> to sea, <S%H3220><s%> and mountain <S%H2022><s%> to mountain. <S%H2022><s%>
Yet the land <S%H776><s%> will be desolate <S%H8077><s%> because of those who live <S%H3427><s%> in it, <S%H6529><s%> for the fruit of their doings. <S%H4611><s%>

Shepherd <S%H7462><s%> your people <S%H5971><s%> with your staff, <S%H7626><s%> the flock <S%H6629><s%> of your heritage, <S%H5159><s%> who live <S%H7931><s%> by themselves <S%H910><s%> in a forest, <S%H3293><s%> in the midst <S%H8432><s%> of fertile pasture <S%H3760><s%> land, <S%H7462><s%> let them feed; in Bashan <S%H1316><s%> and Gilead, <S%H1568><s%> as in the days <S%H3117><s%> of old. <S%H5769><s%>
"As in the days <S%H3117><s%> of your coming <S%H3318><s%> forth out of the land <S%H776><s%> of Egypt, <S%H4714><s%> I will show <S%H7200><s%> them marvelous things. <S%H6381><s%>"

The nations <S%H1471><s%> will see <S%H7200><s%> and be ashamed <S%H954><s%> of all their might. <S%H1369><s%> They will lay <S%H7760><s%> their hand <S%H3027><s%> on their mouth. <S%H6310><s%> Their ears <S%H241><s%> will be deaf. <S%H2790><s%>

They will lick <S%H3897><s%> the dust <S%H6083><s%> like a serpent. <S%H5175><s%> Like crawling things <S%H2119><s%> of the earth <S%H776><s%> they shall come trembling <S%H7264><s%> out of their dens. <S%H4526><s%> They will come with fear <S%H3372><s%> to Yahweh <S%H3068><s%> our God, <S%H430><s%> and will be afraid because of you. <S%H3372><s%>

Who is a God <S%H410><s%> like you, <S%H5375><s%> who pardons iniquity, <S%H5771><s%> and passes over <S%H5674><s%> the disobedience <S%H6588><s%> of the remnant <S%H7611><s%> of his heritage? <S%H5159><s%> He doesn't <S%H2388><s%> retain his anger <S%H639><s%> forever, <S%H5703><s%> because he delights <S%H2654><s%> in loving kindness. <S%H2617><s%>

He will again <S%H7725><s%> have compassion <S%H7355><s%> on us. <S%H3533><s%> He will tread our iniquities <S%H5771><s%> under foot; <S%H7993><s%> and you will cast all their sins <S%H2403><s%> into the depths <S%H4688><s%> of the sea. <S%H3220><s%>

You will give <S%H5414><s%> truth <S%H571><s%> to Jacob, <S%H3290><s%> and mercy <S%H2617><s%> to Abraham, <S%H85><s%> as you have sworn <S%H7650><s%> to our fathers <S%H1><s%> from the days <S%H3117><s%> of old. <S%H6924><s%>
